What is the Ethereum-Verus bridge, and how can I try it out?

The Ethereum-Verus bridge is a decentralized bridge that allows users to transfer and convert coins and tokens between the Ethereum and Verus blockchains. You can try it out on the Rinkeby and Verus Testnet blockchains using MetaMask, Verus Desktop, or the Verus CLI. You can also participate in the community testing effort on Discord in the #pbaas-development channel.

Title: October 2021 — Verus Monthly Recap
Article URL: https://medium.com/veruscoin/october-2021-verus-monthly-recap-eb4b6fd686f1
Content:October 2021 — Verus Monthly Recap
The latest Verus updates on development, community, ecosystem and more. Subscribe to the newsletter here.Next to the monthly recap on Medium, you can receive the exact same content through a newsletter. Subscribe here. I’ll keep things short and to the point.Ethereum Bridge Live on Testnet
The decentralized Ethereum-Verus bridge is now live on Rinkeby and Verus Testnet. It works wonderfully: users can now easily transfer and convert coins and tokens between the two independent blockchains. Try the bridge with MetaMask here, or download Verus Desktop or CLI and activate the Verus Testnet blockchain. Help with the community test effort on Discord in the #pbaas-development channel. Right now, the bridge together with PBaaS are being tested and hardened for deployment on mainnet.
VerusID Marketplace
An update to the mainnet was announced and will give the Verus community an on-chain VerusID marketplace. Users will be able to buy, sell, and make offers on VerusIDs without any intermediaries. It’s the next evolution for VerusID and will make it one of the most powerful NFT systems (and beyond) to date. More details later.
VerUSD Stablecoin
Verus and Valu announce a fully compliant stablecoin for the Verus ecosystem and beyond. The US dollar stablecoin is called VerUSD, is 100% backed with dollar collateral and is FDIC insured. The issuance of the stablecoin is transparent, auditable and controlled by code. Users will be able to easily switch between dollars on their bank account and VerUSD. More details later.
./raw_text_input_medium/October 2021 — Verus Monthly Recap-2021-11-01 13:35:21
What is the VerusID Marketplace, and what features will it have?

The VerusID Marketplace is an on-chain marketplace for VerusIDs, which will allow users to buy, sell, and make offers on VerusIDs without any intermediaries. This will make VerusID one of the most powerful NFT systems available.

What is VerUSD, and what are its features?

VerUSD is a fully compliant stablecoin for the Verus ecosystem, which is 100% backed by dollar collateral and is FDIC insured. The issuance of VerUSD is transparent, auditable, and controlled by code. Users will be able to easily switch between dollars on their bank account and VerUSD.

What is the purpose of the Verus Monthly Recap, and how can I stay up-to-date with the latest updates?

The Verus Monthly Recap is a summary of the latest updates on development, community, ecosystem, and more. You can stay up-to-date with the latest updates by subscribing to the Verus newsletter, which provides the same content as the monthly recap on Medium.
